BBC weather: Rain WARNING for UK as flooding could threaten homes                 UK weather forecast: Wednesday to be HOTTEST October day in 7 years&ldquoOn Wednesday and Thursday warm air pulled in from North Africa will in part influence temperatures before tropical air from the Atlantic has more of an effect on the weather towards the end of the week.&ldquoIt is going to be unusually mild for October, and in the southeast the settled conditions and higher temperatures will hold out into the weekend.Warm, settled weather will be given the shove by a powerful low-pressure cyclone poised to smash into northern Britain at the end of the week.Only the far southeast will hold onto the glorious sunshine while the rest of the nation hunkers down for strong winds and rain.Miss Maxey said: &ldquoThere is a low-pressure system coming in on Friday for which we have issued a warning, this warning may be changed over the next few days.&ldquoThis will depend on the track and the impact of this system, we are not ruling out the possibility of a named storm, but there is a lot of uncertainty at the moment.UK weather forecast: Met Office has warned a storm will hit on Friday (Image: WX Charts)UK weather forecast: Atlantic low pressure is responsible for freak hot weather and storms (Image: WX Charts)The Met Office has issued a severe weather warning for northwest Scotland on Friday where stormy conditions threaten travel chaos and damage to buildings.Coastal regions are on alert for mammoth waves to tumble over sea defences sparking flooding in exposed communities.Gusts will be strong enough to tear branches from trees and hurl debris into the air sparking warnings to take extra care.Met Office chief forecaster Andy Page said: &ldquoGusts 50mph to 60 mph are likely in some places, with potential for gusts of 70mph to 80 mph around exposed coasts and hills, with large waves an additional hazard.&ldquoThere is a small chance of injuries and danger to life from flying debris.&ldquoThere is a slight chance of some damage to buildings, such as tiles blown from roofs.&ldquoRoad, rail, air and ferry services may be affected, with longer journey times and cancellations possible and some roads and bridges may close.&ldquoThere is a slight chance that power cuts may occur, with the potential to affect other services, such as mobile phone coverage.Temperatures will rise widely over the next few days as high pressure over Europe and low-pressure coming in from the Atlantic sets a southerly air flow across the country.Southern Britain is expected to hit 24C (75.2F) at least by mid week while even Scotland and the north will lift into the mid to high teens.Warm and settled weather is likely to hold out across the south with the region looking at sunshine and blue skies for the next week.UK weather forecast: Warm air from Africa (Image: WX Charts)James Madden, forecaster for Exacta Weather, said unseasonable warmth may keep Britons in t-shirts until the middle of October.He said: &ldquoWe also expect warmer than normal conditions to last until at mid-October and possibly beyond.&ldquoThere will be a significant heat surge around the middle of the week and temperatures will rise significantly brining some very warm days.&ldquoHowever one or two low pressure systems pose a risk arriving under a cooler airmass across the country later in the month, these will also be accompanied by some strong winds and stormy conditions.&ldquoThis week however, we could see temperatures back into the 20Cs which is much warmer than normal for the time of year.Netweather &lsquofeels-like&rsquo charts show tropical humidity could make it feel much warmer than ground temperatures suggest.UK weather forecast: Temperatures could hit 25C at the weekend (Image: Netweather)Feels-like temperatures of 29C (84.2F) are forecast across southeastern Britain this weekend with highs of 25C (77F) likely into next week.A muggy air cocktail from North Africa, the Continent and the Atlantic will reach northern England making it feel close to 24C (75.2F) across the region by the middle of the week.Netweather forecaster Terry Scholey said: &ldquoA taste of 'Indian Summer' is on its way, with temperatures perhaps reaching the low-mid twenties Celsius in places on Wednesday, despite the recent drop.WeatherOnline forecaster Simon Keeling added: &ldquoWarm conditions are forecast during this week, especially over the east and south of the country.&ldquoThere will be wind and rain to the west with the risk of severe gales overnight into Friday.&ldquoThe weekend may become cooler for a time before drier and warmer weather returns next week.

title: European Union Italy Matteo Salvini France Marine Le Pen
story: French politician Marine Le Pen ripped into the European Union claiming the Brussels bloc had become &ldquotoo totalitarian.Mrs Le Pen met with Italian Interior Minister Matteo Salvini on Monday after vowing to discuss &ldquoan alternative to Europe.She said: &ldquoWe are not fighting against Europe. We are fighting against the European Union.&ldquoA system that has become too totalitarian.                Italy vows to CLOSE AIRPORTS in row with Germany over migrant flights&ldquoWe are fighting against the EU precisely to save the real Europe.Italy's Deputy Prime Minister Mr Salvini said on Monday the government would not cave&nbspin to&nbspmarket pressure and backtrack on its plans to increase deficit spending next year.He said: &ldquoIf one had evil thoughts, he would think there are people betting on the spread because they don't want Italy to grow and create jobs.Speaking about the Government&rsquos budget plans, Mr Salvini said: &ldquoWe will not backtrack, we will not backtrack.Before the meeting, Ms Le Pen tweeted: &ldquoThanks to the @UGLNazionale for his invitation and @matteosalvinimi for this joint press conference, where we talked about the stakes of the next #Europ&eacuteennes2019 and the ardent need to make the word and power to the People.She later added: &ldquoWorking lunch with @matteosalvinimi in a typical Roman setting.&ldquoThanks to him for his welcome, Bravo for his work at the Ministry of the Interior and cap on them.On Friday, Mrs Le Pen said: &ldquoI will be in Rome on Monday with Matteo Salvini to discuss, at the invitation of Italy&rsquos General Labour Union, economic growth and social prospects in a Europe of nations.Marine Le Pen met with Matteo Salvini to discuss plans for an alternative Europe (Image: )&ldquoThere is an alternative to Europe and we are building it.Mr Salvini has been involved in an ongoing verbal spat with European Commission boss Jean-Claude Juncker over the past two weeks.The pair has repeatedly locked horns over the Italian Government's refusal to back down from a controversial budget proposal to increase its deficit target for next year.

title: Hurricane Michael 2018 weather path Florida NOAA update track NHC latest
story: Hurricane Michael is forecast to strengthen rapidly as it makes its approach towards the Florida Panhandle.Michael is a Category 1 hurricane but is set to become a Category 3 hurricane with winds from 111mph to 129 mph when it strikes the coast of Florida.Forecasters predict the hurricane will bring four to 12 inches (10 to 30cm) of rain with life-threatening flash flooding.Thousands of people are being evacuated as the storm strengthens further.                Tropical storm Michael: Florida declares STATE of EMERGENCY                Hurricane Michael MAP: NOAA path of Hurricane Michael The National Hurricane Center said: &ldquoLife-threatening storm surge is possible along portions of the Florida Gulf Coast regardless of the storm&rsquos exact track or intensity.&ldquoWell-built framed homes may incur major damage or removal of roof decking and gable ends. Many trees will be snapped or uprooted, blocking numerous roads.&ldquoElectricity and water will be unavailable for several days to weeks after the storm passes.Here are the latest updates on Hurricane Michael (all times in BST).Hurricane Michael path LIVE: (Image: EPANHC )1.30pm update: Panic buying epidemic&nbspbeginsAs Hurricane Michael is upgraded to category two, shoppers have begun to panic buy - wiping out whole shop shelves in the panic to prepare for a direct&nbsphit.&nbspShoppers have been stockpiling basics like bread ahead of the expected impact, due on Wednesday, according to local news reporter Matthew Seedorff of WOAI.The Florida-based journalist posted an image from Panama City, which lies directly in the storm's path, on Twitter - which showed empty shelves.He tweeted: The bread aisle is running low at this Publix in Panama City Beach.Hurricane Michael: Florida supermarkets are already facing empty shelves (Image: TWITTER)1.18pm update: Changes to storm warningsThe NHC said: The Tropical Storm Warning for the Cuban province of Pinar del Rio has been discontinued.1.07pm update: Airlines warning of potential cancellations and delays due to the hurricane&nbspDelta Air Lines said journeys that start, end or go through several locations in Florida and Alabama could be affected&nbspThey include:Fort Walton BeachPensacolaTallahasseePanama CityMobile, ALHurricane Michael: The latest NWS hurricane warning map (Image: NWS)13.03pm update: Hurricane Michael&nbspupgraded to category two hurricaneMichael is now 365 miles from Apalachicola, Florida, with maximum sustained winds of 100mph.The NHC said: Additional strengthening is expected, and Michael is forecast to be a major hurricane at landfall in Florida.Weakening is expected after landfall as Michael moves through the southeastern&nbspUnited States.12.56pm update: 'No one will survive'Florida Governor Rick Scott told ABC's Good Morning America program the effects of the storm would not be felt for another 12 hours.But he issued a grave warning of the potential deadly impact of what could be a 12-foot (3.7-meter) coastal storm surge.Asked if there would be more evacuation orders, he said officials were monitoring the situation but that people in potentially affected areas should not take any chances against such a large storm surge.No one's going to survive, such a wall of water, Scott said. Don't take a chance.12.21pm update: Citizens advised to evacuate during the dayFlood water can sometimes be difficult to see during the day - and even more difficult when its dark.Residents are advised to evacuate in daylight hours.The NWS wrote: Much of the central US is contending with very heavy rainfall that will last through the night, resulting in flash flooding in some areas.Seeing flooded roadways in the dark can be very difficult.12.15pm update: How to prepare for a hurricane- latest hurricane adviceDuring a hurricaneAvoid walking or driving through flood waters.Just 6 inches of moving water can knock you down, and fast-moving water can sweep your vehicle away.Be extra careful when walking outside.Storm damage such as downed power lines and fallen debris could injure you.6 hours before arrivalClose storm shutters if possible and stay away from windows.Flying glass from broken windows could injure you.Turn your refrigerator or freezer to the coldest setting and open only when necessary.If you lose power, food will last longer.6 to 12 hours before arrivalTurn on your TVradio, or check your local government&rsquos website frequently.You&rsquoll get the latest weather updates and emergency instructions.Charge your phone.You&rsquoll have a full battery if you lose power.12 to 36 hours before arrivalBring in outdoor furniture and other items that could blow away.These may become a safety hazard.Bookmark your local government&rsquos website.This gives you quick access to storm updates and emergency instructions.Hurricane Michael: The NWS and NOAA issued how to prepare warnings (Image: NOAA)12.05pm update: The NWS warned of a raft of towns to be hitThe weather service tweeted: Hurricane Michael isn't heading to any one town...There are warnings for more than 300 miles of coastline. It's forecast to be a large and dangerous hurricane at landfall.Life-threatening storm surgeDamaging windsLife-threatening flash flooding11.30am update: National Weather Service urges citizens to prepare to evacuate as flood warnings extendedThe NWS said: Flood Watches extend from the Great Lakes to southeastern TX, and heavy rains overnight will bring flash flooding to many locations.Each year, more deaths occur due to flooding than from any other thunderstorm related hazard.Turn Around, Don't Drown.Hurricane Michael: The NWS urged people to be aware of flood warnings (Image: NWS)11.06am updates: Michael to be category 3 storm on landfallThe monstrous storm is forecast to become a major Category 3 hurricane by Wednesday evening, right before it reaches the coastline of Florida.The life-threatening storm should make landfall Wednesday afternoon or evening, likely between Pensacola in the far western Panhandle and Apalachicola, directly south of Tallahassee on the coast.Tallahassee is expected to be hit with dangerous winds up to 55mph from as early as Wednesday morning and people are urged to secure their property and prepare to evacuate.Hurricane Michael, moving north-northwestward through the southern Gulf of Mexico, is located about 390 miles (630 km) south of Apalachicola, Florida with maximum sustained winds of 90 miles per hour (150 kph).The storm is expected to move inland over the Florida Panhandle or Florida Big Bend area on Wednesday, the NHC said.10.45am update: Florida likely to lose power for WEEKSTom Terry, Chief Meteorologist at Florida based news stations WFTV and WRDQ, predicts thousands could lose power, potentially for weeks, as the hurricane makes landfall in Florida on Wednesday.On his Twitter, Mr Terry told his 15,800 followers: &ldquoMany thousands will likely lose power, perhaps for weeks as #Michael will make a direct impact.Hurricane Michael: This NOAA map shows where storm watches and warnings are in place (Image: NOAA)10.18am update: Tornado warning issued in latest NOAA updateThe NOAA said there was now a real threat of tornados late into Wednesday over areas of the Florida Panhandle, the northern Florida Peninsula, and southern Georgia.In its latest update, NOAA said: &ldquoOn the forecast track, the center of Michael will continue to move over the southern Gulf of Mexico this morning, then move across the eastern Gulf of Mexico later today and tonight.&ldquoThe center of Michael is expected to move inland over the Florida Panhandle or Florida Big Bend area on Wednesday, and then move northeastward across the southeastern United States Wednesday night and Thursday.Hurricane Michael was located about 420 miles south of Panama City in Florida, according to the 4am update from National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).Maximum sustained winds measured 90mph and storm was moving north-northwestward though the southern gulf of Mexico at 12mph.Storm surges measuring 3.6m high could lash parts of Florida with warnings of dangerous surf and rip currents.To find out more about the NOAA&nbsp4AM CDT update, click here.Hurricane Michael satellite: Tornado warnings are now in place (Image: NOAA)10.04am update: NOAA 4am CDT update now outThe report read: At 400 AM CDT (0900 UTC), the center of Hurricane Michael was located near latitude 24.1 North, longitude 85.9 West. Michael is moving toward the north-northwest near 12 mph (19 kmh).&nbspA north-northwestward to northward motion is expected through tonight, followed by a northeastward motion on Wednesday and Thursday.On the forecast track, the center of Michael will continue to move over the southern Gulf of Mexico this morning, then move across the eastern Gulf of Mexico later today and tonight.Michael is expected to move inland over the Florida Panhandle or Florida Big Bend area on Wednesday, and then move northeastward across the southeastern United States Wednesday night and Thursday.Maximum sustained winds are near 90 mph (150 kmh) with higher gusts. Strengthening is expected, and Michael is forecast to be a major hurricane at landfall in Florida.Weakening is expected after landfall as Michael moves through the southeastern United States.9.45am update: Expected rainfall levelsWestern Cuba... up to eight inches, with isolated maximum amounts of 12 inches. This rainfall could lead to life-threatening flash floods and mudslides.Florida Panhandle and Big Bend, southeast Alabama, Georgia and South Carolina... four to eight inches, with isolated maximum amounts of 12 inches. This rainfall could lead to life threatening flash floods.Florida Peninsula, Florida Keys, North Carolina, portions of the&nbspMid-Atlantic States, and the southern New England coast... two to four inches with isolated maximum amounts of six inches. This rainfall could lead to life-threatening flash floods.Yucatan Peninsula...Additional rainfall less than one inch.9.33am update: The NOAA reveals where flash flooding and rain will hitThe latest NOAA maps below shows exactly where flash flood warnings are in place and where rainfall is expected to be highest as the hurricane hits this week.&nbspTallahassee and Tampa are expected to be among the worst hit regions as the storm approaches, battering the coast with fierce winds, heavy rain and the likelihood of flash flooding.See the maps below for more details.Hurricane Michael tracker: The NOAA rain radar shows where downpours will hit (Image: NOAA)Hurricane Michael tracker: The NOAA have warned of flash flooding in these areas (Image: NOAA)9.26am update: Citizens urged to prepare ahead of incoming stormThe NHC warned the incoming hurricane could bring flash&nbsprainfall and deadly flooding, as the agency advised residents within the&nbspwarning zone to also prepare for life-threatening winds.Florida Governor Rick Scott declared a state of emergency in 35 counties along the panhandle and Florida's Big Bend regions.About 1,250 National Guard soldiers were aiding the process and more than 4,000 troops placed on standby.In Alabama, Governor Kay Ivey declared an emergency for the entire state on Monday, anticipating wind damage, heavy rains and power outages.9.00am update: Michael becoming unpredictableThe NHC discussion post reads: Michael's steady intensification over the past 48 hours in the face of 20-kt westerly shear defies traditional logic.Either the shear calculations are unrepresentative or Michael has become more inertially stable due to its large eye and large outer wind field, making it more shear resistant.8.41am update: Evacuations underway as storm strengthens&nbspfurtherTens of thousands of people have been ordered to evacuate in Wakulla, Gulf and Bay counties as the barrelling storm approaches.Hurricane Michael could be a Category 3 storm when it makes landfall on Wednesday, becoming the most powerful storm to strike the panhandle in at least a decade.For those considering evacuation, I can't stress strongly enough the importance of leaving as early as possible, Bay County Sheriff Tommy Ford said on Facebook.Evacuation routes can quickly turn into traffic nightmares. Please evacuate now.&nbsp08.17am update: Latest Storm Surge warningsA Storm Surge Warning is in effect for...&bull OkaloosaWalton County Line Florida to Anclote River FloridaA Storm Surge Watch is in National Hurricane Centre advisory warns of changeThe National Hurricane Center (NHC) 's latest advisory warned Michael had changed in strength in the past few hours.Storm surge and hurricane warnings are in effect for the North eastern Gulf Coast.Currently, the hurricane is approximately 425miles south of Apalachicola, Florida, with wind speeds of 90mph.&nbspThe centre of Michael is expected to move inland over the Florida Panhandle or Florida Big Bend area on Wednesday.Michael will then move northeast across the southeastern US Wednesday night and Thursday, the Miami-based weather forecaster added.Despite not altering much in the past few hours, Michael is still forecast to strengthen tonight  (Image: NOAA)5.33am update: Hurricane Michael continues to strengthen&nbspHurricane Michael is continuing to strength and has achieved sustained wind speeds of near 90 miles per hour according to the National Hurricane Centre.&nbspThe Centre asserts: &ldquoSteady to rapid strengthening is forecast during the next day or so, and Michael is expected to become a major hurricane by Tuesday night.&nbspHurricane force winds can be felt up to 35 miles from the centre of the storm.&nbspA hurricane warning is in place from the AlabamaFlorida border to the AlabamaMississippi border.&nbspIn addition hurricane watches are in place for the Cuban province of Pinar del Rio and the coastal area between the Suwannee River and the AlabamaFlorida border.&nbsp &nbsp4.02am update: &ldquoLife-threatening storm surge warning&nbspThe National Hurricane Centre has released another notice stating: &ldquoLife-threatening storm surge is likely along portions of the coasts of the Florida Panhandle, Big Bend and Nature Coast and a storm surge warning is in effect for these areas.&nbsp&ldquoResidents in these areas should follow all advice given by their local officials.They also note: &ldquoA hurricane warning has been issued for portions of the Florida Gulf Coast, and everyone in these areas should prepare for life-threatening winds associated with the core of Michael.&nbsp&ldquoDamaging winds will also extend inland across portions of the Florida Panhandle, southern Georgia and southeast Alabama as Michael moves inland.&nbspHeavy rain, which could potentially cause flooding, is expected across the affected area.&nbsp&nbspHurricane Michael from above (Image: EPA)1.51am update: Indiana Task Force 1 Activated ahead of Hurricane Michael&nbspIndiana state has called-up Task Force 1, an emergency task force, as Hurricane Michael hurtles towards the coast.&nbspTask Force 1 consists of emergency responders as well as civilians from a variety of backgrounds.&nbspMeanwhile the US Air Force has announced it will evacuate its aircraft from Tyndall Air Force Base in Florida.&nbspThey will be flown to alternative bases in Ohio and Texas.&nbspIn a statement the Air Force said: &ldquoEvacuated aircraft and designated personnel will return when the storm danger has passed.1.11am update: Storm surge warning in place for Florida - life threatening conditions&nbspA storm surge warning has been put in effect for the Gulf Coast of Florida from the Anclote River to the OkaloosaWalton County Line.&nbspThis means life threatening conditions are expected within the next 36 hours.&nbspHurricane Michael is forecast to be Category 3 strength by the time it reaches landfall.&nbspHurricane Michael batters hits Havana, capital of Cuba.  (Image: REUTERS)Monday October 811.42pm update: Hurricane warning in place for Florida Gulf Coast&nbspA hurricane warning has been issued by the National Hurricane Centre for the Florida Gulf Coast from the Alabama border to Suwannee River.&nbspThis means hurricane conditions are expected in the area.&nbspIn addition a hurricane watch has been placed along the Alabama coast from the Florida to Mississippi borders, meaning hurricane conditions are possible.&nbspHurricane Michael has increased in strength and now has maximum sustained winds of near 80 miles per hour, and more powerful gusts.&nbspIt is expected to become a major hurricane overnight or early on Tuesday morning.&nbspHurricane strength winds currently extend up to 35 miles out from the centre of the storm.&nbspJames Bickerton takes over live reporting from Liam Doyle&nbsp9.45pm update: NOAA issues latest advisory - Florida Gulf Coast has hurricane warningThe NOAA has issued a selection of new warnings in their latest advisory, with fresh threats for parts of the southwestern US.&nbspThe following warnings are now in effect:A Storm Surge Warning has been issued for the Gulf Coast of Florida from the OkaloosaWalton County Line to Anclote River.The Storm Surge Watch has been extended west of Navarre Florida to the AlabamaFlorida border.A Hurricane Warning has been issued for the Gulf Coast of Florida from the AlabamaFlorida border eastward to Suwannee River.A Hurricane Watch has been issued from the AlabamaFlorida border westward to the MississippiAlabama border.A Tropical Storm Warning has been issued from the AlabamaFlorida border westward to the MississippiAlabama border and from SuwanneeRiver Florida southward to Chassahowitzka Florida.A Tropical Storm Watch has been issued from the MississippiAlabama border westward to the Mouth of the Pearl River.Storms projected route according to the National Hurricane Centre (Image: National Hurricane Centre )9.15pm update: Donald Trump brands Michael a very big oneDonald Trump is speaking at a police chiefs' convention in Orlando, where he talked about the threat of encroaching hurricane Michael, now a category 2, and said it was a very big one.He said: As Hurricane Michael nears landfall, we are working with state and local officials in Florida to take all are in precautions and we urge all residents to be prepared and to heed local officials.I told Rick Scott, we are ready for you.9pm update: Oil production under threat from MichaelMajor American oil companies are at risk from the incoming storm, which have begun to evacuate workers.&nbspThe Gulf coast is home to 17 percent of the daily US crude oil output according to the US Energy Information Administration.&nbspCompanies such as BP Plc and Exxon Mobil are situated in the area, and they have begun&nbspevacuating personnel from Gulf of Mexico production platforms.Gulf of Mexico oil production is under threat from Michael (Image: )8.30pm update: Whitehouse issues tweet on hurricane MichaelThe Whitehouse twitter account has said President Trump is working to aid preparation efforts.The full tweet reads: President @realDonaldTrump is working with state and local officials in Florida on preparedness ahead of Hurricane Michael's landfall.8.03pm update: Storm surge between 7 and 11 feetHurricane Michael has rapidly intensified in the space of 24 hours and if it does come ashore as a major Category 3 or 4 storm on Wednesday, it would be the first &ldquomajor hurricane to strike the US this hurricane season, as Hurricane Florence weakened prior to landfall.The National Hurricane Center is forecasting storm surge between 7 and 11 feet in certain areas, Florida Gov Rick Scott said on Monday.&nbspThe NHS warned of a risk of life-threatening storm surge.Some model projections show declining shear as the storm moves closer to Florida during the next two to three days, allowing for even greater strengthening.While the storm's most damaging impacts will be confined to the region close to where the centre makes landfall, much of the state will see impacts from the hurricane, in the form of heavy rains and gusty winds, particularly along the state's Gulf Coast.Life-threatening storm surge expected along much of the coast of the Florida Panhandle (Image: NHC )7.35pm update: School and university closuresFlorida State University said its campuses in Tallahassee and Panama City will be closed from Tuesday through Friday.All schools in Panama City and surrounding Bay County will be closed from on Tuesday and Wednesday. &nbspLeon County officials in Tallahassee were closing all schools from Tuesday through Friday.&nbspMandatory evacuation orders were issued on Monday for residents in various areas in Gulf Country, Florida, according to a statement from county emergency officials.7.03pm update: NHC latest advisory&nbspIn its latest advisory issued at 2pm EDT (7pm BST) the center said Michael is expected to produce the following rainfall:Western Cuba - 4 to 8 inches with isolated maximum amounts of 12 inchesFlorida Panhandle and Big Bend into the Carolina - 4 to 8 inches with isolated maximum amounts of 12 inchesFlorida Peninsula, Florida Keys, portions of the Mid-Atlantic States, and the southern New England coast - 2 to 4 inches with local amounts of 6 inches, which could lead to life-threatening flash floodsYucatan Peninsula - 1 to 2 inchesHurricane Michael path LIVE: The NHC estimated arrival wind times from Hurricane Michael (Image: NHC )6.38pm update: Florida State University to closeFlorida State University said its campuses in Tallahassee and Panama City will be closed from Tuesday through Friday.The university is expected to return to normal on Monday, October 15.The university announced on Monday that its main Tallahassee and Panama City campuses will close at 12.01am on Tuesday and remain closed for the rest of the week.Students are encouraged to discuss possible travel plans with family and friends.FSU said it is prepared to handle students' needs during the storm and that campus residence halls and dining facilities will remain open.Hurricane Michael path LIVE: A satellite image shows Hurricane Michael off the US Gulf Coast (Image: NOAA )6.14pm update: Hurricane Michael path&nbspThe NHC said in its 11am EDT update (3pm BST) the centre of Hurricane Michael was moving northward near the western tip of Cuba and into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico by Monday evening.The hurricane will then move east the eastern Gulf of Mexico Tuesday and Tuesday night and will move inland over the Florida Panhandle or Florida Big Bend area on Wednesday and move move northeastward across the southeastern United States Wednesday night and Thursday.Hurricane conditions will spread over portions of western Cuba this afternoon, where a hurricane warning is now in effect. Tropical storm conditions are expected over the northeastern Yucatan Peninsula and the Isle of Youth today, the National Hurricane Center said.Michael is expected to produce heavy rainfall and flash flooding over portions of western Cuba and the northeastern Yucatan Peninsula of Mexico during the next couple of days.The current path of Hurricane Michael sees it moving across Cuba and into Florida (Image: NHC )5.51pm update: Watches and warnings in effectThe following watches and warnings are in effect:&bull A Hurricane Warning is in effect for the Cuban province of Pinar del Rio&nbsp&bull A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for the Cuban province of the Isle of Youth and the coast of Mexico from Tulum to Cabo Catoche, including Cozumel&bull A Storm Surge Watch is in effect for Navarre Florida to Anna Maria Island Florida, including Tampa Bay&bull A Hurricane Watch is in effect for Alabama-Florida border to Suwannee River Florida&bull A Tropical Storm Watch is in effect for Suwannee River to Anna Maria Island Florida, including Tampa Bay and Alabama-Florida border to the Mississippi-Alabama borderHurricane Michael path LIVE: Hurricane watches and storm surge warnings are in effect  (Image: NHC )5.34pm update:&nbspState of emergency declared in 26 countiesGov. Rick Scott has declared a state of emergency for 26 counties along the Florida Panhandle and Big Bend.The governor declared a state of emergency for Escambia, Santa Rosa, Okaloosa, Walton, Holmes, Washington, Bay, Jackson, Calhoun, Gulf, Gadsden, Liberty, Franklin, Leon, Wakulla, Jefferson, Madison, Taylor, Hamilton, Suwannee, Lafayette, Dixie, Columbia, Gilchrist, Levy and Citrus counties.A mandatory evacuation order has been issued for coastal areas of Gulf County, according to a news release from the Port St. Joe Police Department.Governor Scott advised Gulf Coast residents to prepare for possible evacuation orders and he has put more than 5,000 National Guard soldiers on alert.He wrote on Twitter: &ldquoFamilies should take the opportunity TODAY to make sure they have three days of food and water, as well as all needed medications.&ldquoEVERY FAMILY must be prepared. We can rebuild your home, but we cannot rebuild your life.The storm will bring torrential rain, heavy winds and dangerous storm surges to many areas of Florida and the northeastern Gulf Coast on Wednesday.Michael is currently 50 miles south of the western tip of Cuba.5.14pm update: Michael develops into Category 1 hurricaneTropical Storm Michael developed into a hurricane on Monday as it continues to strengthen.Michael is a Category 1 hurricane with maximum sustained winds of 75mph and could make landfall as a Category 3 hurricane on the five-step Saffir-Simpson scale.The hurricane is forecast to hit Florida on Wednesday before then moving northeast on Wednesday and Thursday along the Atlantic Coast and batter the Carolinas.Michael has already battered parts of Mexico and Cuba with powerful winds and drenching rains on Sunday and into early Monday.

title: Hurricane Michael 2018 path latest mandatory evacuations Florida storm Bay County
story: The evacuation order was issued on Monday for Bay County, Florida, and will affect around one hundred and twenty thousand residents throughout Panama City Beach, Panama City and Lynn Haven.Sheriff Tommy Ford sent a direct warning to affected residents, saying: &ldquoWe&rsquove practiced this many times. This is game time. This is the real thing. This is a significant threat to life and safety.&ldquoPeople need to start leaving now. The roads are going to get more and more congested as time goes on.&ldquoI promise we will try to get people back in as soon as possible.Bay County Commissioner Bill Dozier also urged residents to leave affected regions immediately, and warned that those who decide to stay need to prepare to be self-sufficient.He said: &ldquoPrepare for your personal need. Stock up your water.&ldquoIf somebody was to stay here, they need to be able to take care of themselves for a period of time.&ldquoDon&rsquot expect the government to help take care of you. You need to take care of yourself.Mandatory evacuation orders have been issued across Bay County in Florida (Image: EPA)Florida residents stocked up on fuel ahead of Hurricane Michael's landfall (Image: )Evacuation orders have been issued for four separate zones - A,B,C,D - where storm surges could occur.Zone A is located along Bay County&rsquos Gulf Coast and large inner waterways, and is considered where storm surge is most likely to occur.Mark Bowen, chief of emergency services in Bay County, commented on the evacuation procedures, saying: &ldquoArea A is closer to water, bay-front properties, lower-lying properties.&ldquoA, B, C folks need to leave. Anyone who can leave on Monday should go on the road today.Hurricane Michael has already brought heavy rainfall to western Cuba (Image: REUTERS)Holidaymakers were urged to stay away from affected regions over the coming days (Image: EPA)&ldquoThey should leave Bay County and go to a pre-designated place.An emergency shelter will be been opened in Deane Bozeman School in Panama City as of 10am Tuesday local time (4pm BST).However, Mr Bowen urged residents to use this only as a last resort.Mr Dozier also urged holidaymakers to reschedule their travel plans to avoid the area over the coming days.                Hurricane Michael: State of emergency declared in 26 counties                Hurricane Michael: Just 48 HOURS until storm PLOUGHS into FloridaEvacuation orders in Bay County will affect around one hundred and twenty thousand residents (Image: EPA)Panama City Beach, Panama City and Lynn Haven are expected to face the worst conditions in the US (Image: EPA)He said: &ldquoIt&rsquos certainly not the best time to come down. Look at resisting your plans to vacation here in Bay County and Panama City Beach.&ldquoSometime next week this will move past us and clear out.&ldquoContinue to keep an eye on the local websites in Panama City Beach. They&rsquoll find another time for their vacation.

story: Hurricane Michael is forecast to make landfall on Wednesday as the dangerous Category 3 hurricane nears Florida.Winds of up to 90mph are currently barrelling towards northeastwards in the Gulf of Mexico before moving inland over the Florida panhandle.Florida Governor Rick Scott has warned about the life-threatening conditions the storm will bring.A BBC Weather tracker shows Hurricane Michael crashing into on Wednesday.                Hurricane Michael 2018: Floridians told to &lsquoLEAVE NOW&rsquo                 State of emergency declared in Alabama ahead of hurricane's landfallA statement read: &ldquoKeeping a close eye on #HurricaneMichael moving northwards through the Gulf of Mexico.&ldquoLikely to strengthen to a major hurricane ahead of making landfall in Florida during Wednesday.A state of emergency has been declared in Florida, including the Panhandle, Bradford, Pasco, Hernando, Pinellas, Hillsborough, Manatee, Alachua, Union, and Baker counties.On Monday,&nbspMr&nbspScott wrote: &ldquoWe are running out of time. Today is the day to get a&nbspplan&nbspbecause tomorrow could be too late.Hurricane Michael: Map tracker shows HUGE storm crash into Florida on Wednesday (Image: BBC)&ldquoIt is critical that you take care of yourself, your family, and your business as Hurricane Michael approaches FL.The Governor also confirmed the Florida Highway Patrol is pre-deploying 100 State Troopers to the Panhandle and Big Bend area of Florida in preparation for Hurricane Michael.He said: &ldquoThese brave law enforcement officers will help save lives &ndash we cannot thank them enough.The latest update from the NOAA reads: &ldquoAt 1.00 AM CDT (7am&nbspBST), the center of Hurricane Michael was located by and Air Force Reserve reconnaissance aircraft near latitude 23.6 North, longitude 85.7 West.&ldquoMichael is moving toward the north-northwest near 12 mph (19 kmh). A northward to north-northwestward motion at a slightly faster forward speed is expected through tonight, followed by a northeastward motion on Wednesday and Thursday.On the forecast track, the centre of Michael will continue to move over the southeastern Gulf of Mexico this morning, then move across the eastern Gulf of Mexico later today and tonight.&ldquoThe centre of Michael is expected to move inland over the Florida Panhandle or Florida Big Bend area on Wednesday, and then move northeastward across the southeastern United States Wednesday night and Thursday.&ldquoReports from the Hurricane Hunter aircraft indicate that maximum sustained winds are near 90 mph (150 kmh) with higher gusts. Steady to rapid strengthening is forecast during the next day or so, and Michael is expected to become a major hurricane by Tuesday night.&ldquoHurricane-force winds extend outward up to 35 miles (55 km) from the centre and tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 175 miles (280 km).

title: jeremy corbyn is so thick putin
story: Vladimir Putin heads what is now, for all intents and purposes, a rogue state.The former KGB man treats international law as just rules to be broken.And in all of this, he is aided by useful idiots here in the UK.It’s an old-school Soviet tactic. Find a gullible public figure who will cheerlead for the Russian regime while spreading doubt and misinformation.But even in his wildest dreams, the former KGB man never would have thought he’d have the Leader of the Opposition parroting his propaganda.We can never forget that Jeremy Corbyn’s first response to the Salisbury attacks was to suggest shipping samples to the Russians.Here is a man who wants to be Prime Minister, yet is so blindingly thick that he thinks we should have given Vlad the chance to mark his own homework.The diligent work of the Anglo-Dutch intelligence operation to reveal further evidence of Moscow’s criminality must be applauded. But would the Dutch have even let our security services know about their investigationit meant Corbyn would be briefed on it We’d be a global laughing stock, cut off from our allies for years.Corbyn has done the work of tyrants and totalitarians all his le. And he’d do the same in Downing Street.BRITAIN should match Australia’s commitment to eliminate cervical cancer within the next  years.Their screening and vaccination scheme has brought the number of new cases down to nearly zero, and they intend to finish the job.It is EXACTLY what we should aspire to. Here, this avoidable disease takes nearly a thousand mothers, sisters, daughters and wives each year.They could still be alive.Health Secretary Matt Hancock should set a target for the UK, too.And secure funding to consign cervical cancer to the dustbin of history.DONALD Tusk wasted no time in raining on Theresa May’s post-Conference parade.He knows full well that we will not accept a deal which splits up the UK.And he also knows his comments yesterday make le more dficult for Mrs May — who he pretends to “respect”.And spare us the faux outrage about Jeremy Hunt’s comments. At least the Foreign Secretary is elected by voters, not bureaucrats.Tusk is a walking and talking reminder that we’re better off out.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: sun says remoaners unilever lies
story: When its boss Paul Polman insisted it “had nothing to do with Brexit” they called him a liar.They said it beggared belief he had failed to blame the Leave verdict, as they so desperately wanted.Not that they were unhappy Unilever were going. Far from it. These people now take a warped delight in bad news.But Unilever has changed its mind.It’s staying.If Brexit was to blame for it leaving, as Remainers argued, can we assume Unilever has now decided Brexit will be a roaring success  Or shall we just take Mr Polman at his word The sad reality is that many previously sane, serious, objective politicians, journalists, academics and others have lost their minds since the referendum upended their world.To rubbish or reverse the vote, they have taken to spouting blatant lies and utter drivel.Tomorrow thousands will march on Parliament with their DOGS to demand a second referendum.It won’t be just the hounds barking.IT’S not enough for President Macron that his popularity in France is at a catastrophic low.He seems bent on becoming the most hated man in EU history too.This egomaniac Napoleon styles himself the saviour of the Brussels project, the man who made Britain change its mind.Britain hasn’t. And won’t. But Macron remains the greatest roadblock to a deal benefiting both sides and safeguarding hundreds of thousands of livelihoods.What does he think will happenhe personally engineers a no-deal outcome The world will look with loathing on the little Frenchman whose Olympian self-regard, blinkered love for the EU and refusal to respect our democracy destroyed jobs across the Continent.And what of Irish PM Leo Varadkar Only now, after two years of showboating intransigence, is he apparently waking up to the disaster looming for his economy.Voters will be merciless with both.IMAGINE handing out awards to lawyers for persecuting old soldiers over their actions during The Troubles decades ago. The callousness boggles the mind.These men are being put through hell for doing their duty.But the Northern Ireland Office “Legacy Policy Team” are up for civil service gongs.What will they getthey throw some -year-old veteran in jail  Knighthoods We always hoped the Government felt some shame over this witch-hunt.Turns out officials are delighted with how it’s all going.Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: hurricane michael florida latest evacuation storm tracker
story: The monstrous storm is tipped to make landfall late today or early tomorrow with experts warning of devastating winds topping  mph.We are running out of time...TODAY is the day to get a plan, because tomorrow could be too late, tweeted Florida Governor Rick Scott on Monday night.Mandatory evacuations are now underway in coastal areas, with , National Guard soldiers aiding the exodus with more than , troops on standby.Residents frantically filled sandbags, boarded up homes and shops and secured boats - as it was revealed the storm could be even worse than first feared.Schools have also been evacuated as Florida and Alabama prepare for wide-spread power outages, floods, mudslides, wind damage and torrents of rain.After pummelling Florida, Michael is forecast to move northeast and drench the Carolinas - still recovering from the devastation left last month by Hurricane Florence.It is feared the storm - which has already battered Cuba -  could spark le-threatening flash floods and terrying mudslides.Forecasters say the centre of Michael will move across the eastern Gulf of Mexico sometime on Tuesday evening.One expert has said it could be one of the worst hurricanes ever to strike Florida.Governor Scott called Michael a “monstrous storm” after declaring a state of emergency in  counties along the panhandle and Big BendMichael was designated by the National Hurricane Center as a Category  hurricane Monday as it churned off Cuba’s western tip.Governor Scott tweeted: “Let’s all stay safe and watch this storm closely. As we have seen before, it can change direction and impact any part of our state.“EVERY FAMILY must be prepared. We can rebuild your home, but we cannot rebuild your le.”He added: This storm will be le-threatening and extremely dangerous.Currently a Category  storm on the five-step Saffir-Simpson wind scale, Michael could grow into a Category , becoming the second major hurricane in the Atlantic basin this year following Florence. He said: “Interests in the Florida Panhandle should begin preparations and continue them into Tuesday morning.Hurricane conditions are possible in the region by Wednesday with damaging winds, dangerous storm surge, and heavy rain.Currently, the storm is about  miles South East of Cozumel, Mexico in the Yucatan Peninsula.Before hitting the US, Tropical Storm Michael will bring heavy rain and power outages to parts of the Yucatan Peninsula and Western Cuba.Accuweather Senior Meterologist Mike Doll said: “Through Monday, flooding rain is expected across far eastern portions of the Yucatan Peninsula and far western Cuba.”Michael is the th named storm of the  hurricane season, according to hurricane center spokesman Dennis Feltgen.

title: jean claude juncker everything wrong with eu
story: He is everything that’s wrong with the European project — and why it’s so vital that we leave.In his latest rant, he demanded “respect” and delivered a warning that “Press freedom has its limits”. Why Alas, Luxembourg’s finest is annoyed that the media keep reporting on the persistent rumours that he is half-cut most of the time.He must be to think, as he does, that the UK would have voted Remainonly HE had been involved in the referendum. Fat chance. He’d have doubled the Leave vote.The trials and tribulations of Brexit might have made some wonderit’s all worth the hassle. So it’s good of Jean-Claude, a puffed-up political pygmy, to remind us why we’re better off out.Brexiteers need to keep their eyes on the prize. Attention-seeking bores like Andrew Adonis and Alastair Campbell, plus shadowy campaign outfits, are trying their hardest to undermine Brexit.Nobody should think this battle is won. Nobody should be complacent about political battles still to come.And nobody who believes in a prosperous, independent nation should allow the perfect to be the enemy of the good when it comes to Britain’s departure, and walk into the Remainers’ “people’s vote” trap.We leave in less than six months. And when we do, we’ll raise a glass. Maybe Jean-Claude will join us.THE Universal Credit system IS a good idea – but the roll-out must be done properly.The Tories’ benefit changes in the last Government, making it more rewarding to be in work, are a big part of the ­reason employment is at a record high. UC is the final part of that puzzle.But reports that some working families could lose signicant amounts of cash overnight are deeply worrying.Our benefits regime needs to be firm.But it must also be fair.BOB Geldof warns Britain will be a ­“cultural jail” after Brexit.Quite why the power to strike our own trade deals will affect our ability to play guitar isn’t yet clear.In fact, when it comes to music, it’s Britain’s institutions that are more­ ­dangerous. The BBC has decided in its infinite wisdom to publish its entire archive of classical music to compete with streaming services and record labels. Why  Just because it can It’s a decision that sums up the big-state, God-complex thinking that seeps right through the BBC.Lord Hall promised to change Auntie’s tune – but he’s still hitting the wrong notesOur journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: picture burglar thong skirt
story: Weirdo Joe Vincent, , broke into the flat, leaving messages on a window in lipstick and poured oil on the floor.He then dressed in a peach-coloured thong and black and cream mini skirt belonging to law firm worker Daisy Cook, .She ed home to find the thug brandishing one of her kitchen knives and shouting: “Daisy, I am your cousin and want you to leave him.”Daisy and her boyfriend wrestled with the mohawked raider, who then fled.When police later tracked him down he was still wearing the thong and skirt under his clothes.Peter Gair, prosecuting, told Ipswich Crown Court: “The occupant had been out drinking with friends and ed home at about am.“She walked through a communal area to the entrance to her flat and she could hear someone inside saying ‘Daisy, I am your cousin and want you to leave him’.“This defendant opened the door and was holding a black handled serrated kitchen kne taken from her kitchen.”Vincent ran upstairs followed by the pretty brunette who watched on in horror as he grabbed a bottle of bleach.“She was screaming for him to get out of the flat. He ran downstairs and out of the front-door and got away,” Mr Gair added.“The property was ransacked and there were some unusual statements written in lipstick referring to Daisy.”Vincent - high on LSD, heroin, amphetamines and cannabis - bizarrely added his name to Miss Cook’s tenancy agreement despite not knowing her.He fled back to his home, but cops were called after he failed to pay for a £ taxi journey.Mr Gair added: “Police were called and he was taken into custody and saw he was wearing a black and cream mini skirt and peach coloured thong under his clothing.”Kelly Fernandez-Lee, mitigating, said her client had gone on a “binge” of drugs before the incident on September . “It’s all extremely bizarre”, she said.Following the incident Daisy posted on Facebook [not heard in court]:Speaking about the bizarre break in, Daisy said: “He had trashed out whole flat and then he threatened us with knives and bleach when we tried to get in.“He went through all my belongings and found my tenancy agreement which he then crosse my name out and wrote his name on it.“He wrote my name and some weird messages using my makeup all over the windows and mirrors around the house.“He took everything out of the washing machine, poured oil over all the carpets and the bed and threw all our clothes everywhere.“He wrote on my clothes with eyeliner. Please can someone explain who the f**k does this sh*t.”Daisy added: “I actually feel sick. I can’t touch any of my things because he’s gone through all of it.Knowing a stranger has been inside your home touching and going through all of your things whilst you aren’t there is such a terrying thought.“I can’t believe this has happened… the guy even left his I.D, wallet and his birth certicate.”Daisy revealed police had even taken photos of Vincent in her underwear.Vincent, of Ipswich, Suffolk, admitting burglary and was jailed for just  months on Monday.Judge John Devaux sentenced him to three months, concurrently, for doing a runner from the taxi.He said the actions had been “aggravated” by the drink and drugs and Vincent carrying the kne.

title: penny mordaunt aid budget shake up
story: In a radical shake up of DFID spending, the new Cabinet minister wants private investors such as pension funds to prop up Britain’s generous overseas programmes instead.The nation will still meet the controversial target of .% of its annual income on foreign aid.But the Government wants to enforce a major change to international rules to allow non-government cash also to be used to meet the target, under Ms Mordaunt’s blueprint.In a major speech today, she will argue that the shake up is the only way to make Britain’s massive £bn aid budget sustainable for the long-term with pressure increasing on Treasury coffers.A source close to the Development Secretary said: “How we do aid is changing. It’s now much more about projects that help a country’s economy, which means there is an opportunity there for private money to make a .“Penny believes that means when investors step in, the taxpayer can step back, freeing up billions to spend where in government.”The key to the plan’s success is persuading the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development international watchdog to reform tight rules about what currently constitutes aid spending – officially known as Official Development Assistance .Ms Mordaunt – seen as a potential Tory leader of the future - is also expected to make clear today that the government will work with the OECD for reform.But she will also reserve the nation’s right to act unilaterallythe watchdog refuses the changes, as other countries such as the Netherlands already have.Ms Mordaunt’s plans have already won the backing of Chancellor Philip Hammond, The Sun has also learned.But they won’t come into effect for four years, as the government will stand by the current aid projects that it has already committed to.But we should also repeal that foolish legislation and dish out sums case-by-case, only to veriably worthwhile causes.Brits are famously generous over aid.But notit funds absurd vanity projects or corrupt regimes.GOT a story  RING The Sun on    or WHATSAPP on  or EMAIL exclusive@the-sun Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: theresa may no deal brexit bluff
story: Europe’s leaders have spent days talking up the chances of an agreement at the Brussels meeting next week, which they have dubbed the “moment of truth”, in a bid to bounce Britian.But in a surprise move yesterday with just nine to go, the angry PM threw talks into go-slow mode and accused the EU of being the block.“Big issues” still remain to be resolved and that still “requires movement on the EU side”, No insisted.Mrs May is holding out for “a precise future framework” from Brussels over the shape of the UK-EU trade deal to avoid a ‘blind Brexit’.It has emerged that EU negotiators want to fob her off with a brief list of aspirations as short as three pages long.A second sticking point is the EU’s failure to accept a UK wide customs solution as a backstop to keep the Irish border open.And until that changes, The Sun understands No will refuse to put forward a fresh proposal on regulations to seal agreement on the backstop.In a move that will infuriate Brussels, the PM’s official spokesman also refused to commit to forging a deal at the October summit, only pledging to strike one “this autumn”.The spokesman added: “There is a dference between people talking optimistically about a deal, and a deal - including a withdrawal deal and a future framework - actually being agreed”.Laying down the quid pro quo, the spokesman said: “It is worth repeating that there can be no withdrawal agreement without a precise future framework.”The PM also suspended a visit to Brussels by Brexit Secretary Dominic Raab this week until the EU budges.As tension ratcheted last night, DUP boss Arlenne Foster took the rare move of flying to Brussels for a three days of intensive talks.The Northern Irish power-broker will meet Michel Barnier in a bid to find a “backstop” deal that the Ulster-hardliners can support, but she reiterated her vow to block any move to create new checks for the province.But their “deal” is merely their wishlist, much of it utterly unacceptable.Take the idea that, to solve the Irish border problem they blew out of all proportion, we should ide up the UK with customs checks between Northern Ireland and the mainland.Or the suggestion that we stay in the Customs Union indefinitely.The EU pretend we would be fully free once they are happy that technology can police the Irish border.But Brussels would NEVER agree that time is right. Why would they Britain would be exactly where they want us. Trapped for ever, barred from forging a future as an independent trading nation and powerless within the EU too. They wouldn’t give the border issue another thought.Why would our PM agree to that  Especially having risked everything getting MPs to back staying out of the Customs Union in July  It would be a craven, historic surrender.So would signing away our £billion orce payment in exchange for some vague list of EU aspirations about trade.That money must buy a legally binding, detailed, irreversible agreement.Mrs May will need every ounce of courage in the next fortnight.But no deal IS better than the bad ones Brussels aims to railroad her into.She said: “The UK single market must be protected with no new borders between Northern Ireland and Great Britain being created.From day one this has been the DUP’s only red line”.In a further sign that Brexit talks were slowing down, the PM’s chief exit adviser Olly Robbins was yesterday spotted in a Brussels pub drinking red wine alone.Mr Robbins had travelled to resume technical talks with the EU Commission but talks had finished by five thirty in the afternoon - despite claims they were going to the wire.And Brexit is not on the official Cabinet agenda today - with Ministers meeting to discuss the Budget, the anniversary of the Race Audit and World Mental Health day instead.Despite vowing to take the PM on after party conference over the shape of the future relationship with the EU, last night there were no plans for Ministers to tackle Mrs May directly today.Browbeaten senior Tories believe they would only be “shut down”they tried to raise the issue, as the PM has a tight control over the agenda.But there is anger around the top table at the lack of “open discussion” in Cabinet about the direction of Brexit talks after Mrs May only read out an update at last week’s meeting and did not accept questions.Meanwhile senior Brexiteers were last night plotting to keep pressure on Theresa May in the run up to next week’s crunch EU Council meeting.The powerful ERG bloc will meet in the Commons tonight in a show of strength, following a conference call of senior figures last night to plot tactics.One source told the Sun: “The critical thing is that we need to be on the front foot rather than responding to No. all the time.It came amid a bitter fallout after Bernard Jenkin was accused of plotting to vote down the Budgetthe Government sought Labour votes to secure a Brexit deal in the Commons.As senior Brexiteers bickered behind the scenes, one told the Sun: “He shouldn’t have done that – it’s a major problem.The view has been that he’s too close to No. and a bit soft which made it even harder to understand.He’s not a freedom fighter.”Separately Labour MPs rejected suggestions Tory whips had been in contact with as many as  to force through the Chequers plan.One said: “Why would they before we know what the deal is ”Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: met chief mackey westminster bridge
story: Deputy commissioner Sir Craig Mackey said he stayed in his chauffeur-driven car as nobody with him had protective equipment or a radio.He was about to be driven out of Parliament after a ministerial meeting when Khalid Masood fatally stabbed PC Palmer, , in March last year.Masood, , had also driven into and killed four people on Westminster Bridge.He was shot dead by armed police.Sir Craig told an inquest into the killer’s death he heard a loud bang then saw Masood looking like “a clear threat”.A colleague in the car locked the door, then Sir Craig saw the terrorist carrying “a butcher’s kne”, which he used to repeatedly stab PC Palmer with in a “very determined” way.After hearing the shots that killed Masood, Sir Craig said he tried to leave the car but a cop told him to stay. He added: “It was the right thing to do.”The inquest at the Old Bailey continues.GOT a story  RING The Sun on    or WHATSAPP on  or EMAIL exclusive@the-sun Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: princess eugenie wedding bigger meghan
story: The star-studded nuptials of Prince Andrew and Fergie’s youngest daughter this Friday will be a match – in size at least – for Harry’s and Meghan’s epic celebrations. The two-day affair includes at least three costume changes, three parties, three florists and, of course, lashings of celebs.But #royalwedding is not without its share of controversy.Royal Correspondent EMILY ANDREWS gives readers the low-down.EUGENIE, , has always pushed fashion boundaries – with mixed success. But now it is odds on she will have one of the world’s top designers creating her wedding dress.London-based Erdem Moralioglu dressed her for the engagement photos and is expected to have created at least one of the three dresses Eug will wear .Eugenie says her dress will have “no meringue shoulders” and will be the work of a “British-based designer”.She added: “As soon as we announced the wedding, I knew the designer and the look.”Stella McCartney, who designed Meghan’s evening wedding gown, is in the running, alongside Jenny Packham, Phillipa Lepley, Suzanne Neville and Alice Temperley.Like every royal bride, Eugenie will wear a veil and a tiara – most likely the York Tiara which is owned by mum Fergie.The Duchess of York wore the tiara, a gt from the Queen and Prince Philip, as she wed Prince Andrew in .Eugenie’s bouquet is expected to feature York white roses, dad Andrew’s favourite gardenias, lily of the valley and a sprig of ivy to represent the couple’s marital home – Ivy Cottage in the grounds of Kensington Palace.JACK, , may be best described as a former barman who now works for George Clooney, but his ancestors are just as illustrious as his fiancée’s.Named after his great-grandfather Sir Jack Coke, he is related to the princess through Viscount Powers­court as well as the Earl of Harewood.Wealthy in their own right, his family are stalwarts of the Cha scene.He met Eugenie in the posh Swiss ski resort of Verbier in .Like her, he’s a daredevil skier and enjoys partying.He used to manage Mayfair club Mahiki and now acts as brand ambassador for Casamigos tequila, co-founded by George Clooney and Rande Gerber, aka Mr Cindy Crawford.Like Eug, he went to a posh schooland loves country pursuits such as fishing and shooting.He even has his own coat of arms, complete with a severed deer’s head, so he fits right in with the royals.LIKE Harry and Meghan’s May wedding, Jack and Eugenie’s ceremony will be in St George’s Chapel, Windsor Castle.Starting at am, it will be a traditional service with the Dean of Windsor officiating. Archbishop of York John Sentamu has written a special prayer. A sprinkling of showbiz will come from Italian opera superstar Andrea Bocelli, who will sing two songs during the service.State trumpeters from the Band of the Household Cavalry will perform a fanfare during the service.And the Grenadier Guards, of which Prince Andrew is Colonel, will line the West Steps as the couple leave as man and we. The bridal party will be very much a family affair. Big sister Beatrice, , will be maid of honour, while Jack’s younger brother Tom, , is reported to be best man.Five-year-old Prince George reprises his role as page boy, while Princess Charlotte, three, Maud Windsorand Robbie Williams’ six-year-old daughter Theodora “Teddy” are expected to be flower girls. HARRY and Meghan had a modest  guests, while Eugenie and Jack are taking their list up to , with all the senior royals present – except one.Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, raised eyebrows when she said she would be attending a school harvest festival in Scotland instead.Even Prince Philip – who will usually not be in the same room as Fergie – is turning up on Friday for his granddaughter’s big day.Prince Harry’s ex-girlfriend Cressida Bonas is one of Eugenie’s best pals, while another of his ex-squeezes, singer Ellie Goulding, is also a friend. Other pop stars on the list include James Blunt and EdSheeran.Fergie’s friendship with supermodel Naomi Campbell almost certainly guarantees her an invite.Model Cara Delevingne and Poldark actress Gabriella Wilde are also expected to be there. Given the groom’s job with their tequila brand, George and Amal Clooney, Cindy Crawford and Rande Gerber should be present.Robbie Williams and we Ayda Field are friends of Fergie, while the Beckhams were said to have been invited but can’t make it.The parents of Natasha Ednan-Laperouse, who was killed by an allergic reaction to a sandwich, have also been invited after Fergie met them on the plane as they were bringing home the -year-old’s body.Despite , members of the public being invited to attend in the grounds of Windsor Castle, hotels in the area are slashing prices this week after a lack of interest.IT would not be a wedding. let alone a royal one, without a controversy or two. And with Air Miles Andy and Freebie Fergie at the helm, Jack and Eug’s big day has not escaped a bit of carping.The Duke of York was desperate for his daughter’s wedding to be broadcast on the BBC, but talks broke down. The broadcaster eventually refused as it felt the lack of public interest would mean it didn’t get bang for its buck.With only weeks to go, Andrew told Buckingham Palace courtiers that it had to be televised somehow. At the last moment, ITV’s This Morning picked up the baton.The wedding will be shown in America by TLC, a gloriously trashy channel, responsible for shows such as Dr Pimple Popper, Sister Wives,  Day Fiancé and My lb Le.Security for the wedding is said to cost £million and will be funded by UK taxpayers, to the annoyance of pressure groups such as anti-monarchy Republic, which says it is a waste of money.More than , people have signed its petition saying there should be no public funding. It is worth bearing in mind that Harry and Meghan’s wedding cost taxpayers around £million.The rest of Eug’s big day is estimated at £.million, which is being paid for by the Queen and the Duke of York. However, Andrew likes to get help with his financial outlay, so there may well be a Hello! photoshoot on the cards.Camilla missing the wedding is also something of a mystery.The Duchess says her prior engagement was booked months agobut sources close to the Yorks were said to be astonished when they heard she was not attending.They apparently asked her to reconsider, but Camilla did not want to let down the pupils at their school harvest festival.Jack will not be given a royal title, but Eugenie is certainly not giving up hers.While most posh Sloanes would become Mrs Jack Brooksbank, Eug will still be titled Princess Eugenie of York.HARRY and Meghan had two parties, Jack and Eug will have three.First up is a formal post-wedding lunch hosted by the Queen at ­Windsor Castle. Then on Friday evening, Andrew and Fergie will host a black-tie reception at the family home of Royal Lodge, Windsor, where both still live despite their orce in .Anyone still standing will be invited toto Royal Lodge on ­Saturday afternoon for what is billed as a “festival and funfair” themed party.This third celebration has been organised by Bentleys Entertainment – the A-list party planning firm founded by Peregrine Armstrong-Jones, who created the Beckhams’ ­wedding spectacular back in .It will feature dodgems, coconut shies and food stalls plus “loads of cocktails including bloody Marys for the hangovers”. While HM needed only one of Windsor’s state apartments, St George’s Hall, to toast the happy couple post chapel, Eugenie and Jack’s wedding party are taking over three – adding the Grand Reception Room and Waterloo Chamber, where guests will be served champagne, ­canapés and wedding cake.And that cake will be a chocolate and red velvet sponge, decorated with the “rich colours of autumn” and sprigs of ivy.No expense has been spared on the floral ­decorations with Eugenie deciding that a ­princess needs three luxury florists. Elton John fave Rob van Helden will be arranging the blooms at St George’s, alongside Mayfair firm Pulbrook  Gould and Paul Thomas at Royal Lodge.Given the spectacular flower arches that were created for Harry and Meghan, you can bet Rob will want to go onebetter.Is that because Eugenie and Jack have a low profile We took a photo of the couple out on the streets of London to find outthe public actually know who the royal couple are.And the result  Out of  people questioned, only three could name her and NOBODY recognised him.Builder Alan Smith, , guessed the woman in the picture was an actress.He then added: “I had no idea her wedding was on Friday. I certainly didn’t get an invite.”Fellow builder Richard Adams, , said: “I thought she might be someone in the Cabinet and that maybe he was a comedian.”Sam Scales, a -year-old student from Australia, said: “I think she’s a princess. I couldn’t name her but bloody hell she’s got some chompers on her.”His Aussie mate, Matthew Thompson, added: “Didn’t she wear a bad hat once “He looks like Shrek when he goes to human form – or a combination of Martin Freeman and Benedict Cumberbatch.”Accountant Nyasha Masalagc, , said: “I’ve never seen them before in my le. Is she an actress and he a politician ”David Connor, a -year-old taxi driver, said: “That’s Fergie’s daughter. I don’t know the bloke’s name but I know he’s loaded and that’s why she’s marrying him.”Investment banker Alec Murray-Brown, , recognised her. He said: “My sister is a huge fan of the royals so I know all of them. I’m not sure of his name but he’s wearing a signet ring. He’ll be aristocratic.”And Lewis Edwards, a -year-old plumber, said: “Not a clue. But they look pretty pleased with themselves.“She’s clearly a posh bird and he’s a posh boy.”Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: regular bedtime increases fertility
story: Those who hit the sack at roughly the same time each night were four times more likely to conceive within a year. Experts believe the body clock — linked to several diseases via disruptive sleep patterns — may play a role in fertility.US researchers asked  women ­trying to get pregnant to wear a smartwatch that monitored activity levels.There was a four-fold rise in conception in a year for those who went to bed in the same hour timeframe each night.Women turning in within the same -minute period were more than twice as likely to get pregnant, according to the study from Washington University in St Louis.Dr Elizabeth Ginsburg, from the American Society for Reproduction, said: “We know adequate sleep is important to normal regulation and heathy ing. This study indicates that for women planning to conceive, the establishment of regular sleep habits could be advantageous.”A separate study by the University of Miami found that every hour of lost sleep caused testosterone levels to fall by . per cent. Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: philip hammond refuses to increase spending on no deal planning in the budget that would strengthen pms hand in brexit talks
story: The Chancellor has been urged by some in Government to set aside even more funds to prepare for a collapse in negotiations, beyond the £ billion he earmarked in .But Treasury insiders say he is resisting any increase, evenit strengthened Theresa May’s negotiating hand and is likely the cash will never have to be spent.The issue could come to a head as soon as today as the Cabinet discuss the Budget.One Cabinet Minister told The Sun “it seems like a no-brainer” as Brexit talks go to the wire, as it would send the message to Brussels that Britain really is ready to walk away.And a senior Government source added they “definitely need” more cash to prepare for the doomsday scenario of Britain exiting the EU without a trade deal in place next March.But Treasury sources insisted there was already enough funding for emergency planning scenarios.Last night leading Brexiteer Iain Duncan Smith publicly backed calls for more money, saying: “How can the PM say we are preparing to leave the EU without a deal when her Chancellor is refusing to pay for it ”And in an extraordinary blast, the former Tory leader added: “If the money isn’t forthcoming the it means the Treasury is acting like government saboteurs - hell bent on wrecking Brexit.”The spat comes as the business chiefs urged Mr Hammond to use his fiscal statement in two weeks time to radically prepare the country for exit with a £ billion package.The CBI’s plans include more than doubling the tax breaks export firms get to invest in their own factories to £, and doubling apprenticeship investment to get Britain Brexit ready.They also suggest a business rates holiday for any firm that conducts a major overhaul of their store, factory or office.Boss Carolyn Fairburn said: “As the UK leaves the EU, there is no better moment than this Budget to show the Government is committed to real partnership with business.”Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes. title: packaging chemical may induce premature birth
story: And experts warn the substance - Bisphenol A - could be affecting women before they even get pregnant.Urine samples showed those with the highest levels of BPA before they conceived were six times more likely to have a premature birth.BPA is used in the lining of some food cans, plastic containers and water bottles and disrupts hormones.Experts already feared that exposing pregnant women to it increased the risk of premature birth.It has also been linked to cancer and asthma.Now docs at Hard Chan School of Public Health in Boston have shown the impact on women could happen even earlier.They took samples from  women before they fell pregnant. Of these,  gave birth to premature babies.The research, which was presented at the annual meeting of the American Society for Reproductive Medicine in Denver, also found that phthalates, a chemical used in food containers, doubled the risk of early birth.Jenner Yland, who led the study, said: Exposure to these chemicals is widespread, as they are found in food packaging, consumer products, medical devices, plastic bottles, and thermal receipts.It is thought that the two compounds can cause tiny changes to a woman’s eggs which later trigger premature labour.Dr Peter Schlegel, president-elect of the American Society for Reproductive Medicine , says: This research points out that pre-conception factors are important but often poorly understood factors in reproduction. Our journalists strive for accuracy but on occasion we make mistakes.
